interview_metadata.general_comments: Rick Rule discusses royalty companies as the best risk-adjusted way to play commodities, especially gold and uranium. He notes the deep undervaluation of uranium juniors, sees value in high-quality gold/silver royalty leaders, and stresses business model durability. Rick explains that most investors misunderstand both uranium term contracts and the capital efficiency of the royalty model. He ranks major royalty companies, is forthright about his ownership interests, and describes strong optionality for leading firms due to future large streaming deals. He also highlights specific concerns and optimism for coal, oil, and water-handling royalties, forecasting a wave of M&A and sector rerating.

company_info.pos_comments: Unique business model in uranium, owns physical pounds, well-positioned for future streaming/royalty growth. Company is 'fairly cashed-up' with no operating costs and ability to enter term contracts at will.
company_info.neg_comments: Not aggressive enough buying royalties recently (in hindsight, wise given weak junior funding).

company_info.pos_comments: Best-in-class royalty major, extremely efficient (11bps G&A), strong recycle ratio, expects big optionality from global copper/gold streaming deals and potential Panama legal settlement. Historically high cash flow yield.
company_info.neg_comments: Panama (Cobre Panama) disruption removed 14% of NAV and caused 42% share price drop; timing for resolution unclear.

company_info.pos_comments: Co-best in class; exceptional management, efficient, broad portfolio, strong price-to-future-NAV. Will benefit from wave of big copper/gold streaming deals.

company_info.pos_comments: Owns stable of assets, strong management brought in, expects several strong years. Sister company to Uranium Royalty; management regarded highly.
